titleStmt.title: J. D. Landrum et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10293

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Graves County, would respectfully, say to Your Excellency that at the Feby Term 1861 of the Graves Equity and Criminal Court our fellow Citizen, John A Cannon, was tried and fined Seventy five dollars for a Breach of the Peace. We would say to you Sir, that he was drunk at the time the offense was committed, and no doubt did wrong, but under all circumstances as of the transaction, we think the fine was excessive and ought to be remitted as far as Excellency can under the law. fines of that character Mr Cannon is a man has a wife and children to by his own industry, and it is as he can well do to provide for and the times being or hard branch of business and so paralise at this time, it would irreparable injury to Mr Cannon his family for them to have said fine to pay, indeed he can not well do it without sacrifice
We would therefore earnestly urge your Excellency to interpose in his behalf and releive him. March 16h 1861

Very Respectfully
